props.type: FormControl.Label | FormControl.Caption | FormControl.Validation | Autocomplete | TextInput | TextInputWithTokens | Select

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the control allows user input

props.name: id
props.description: The unique identifier for this control. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text

props.name: required
props.description: If true, the user must specify a value for the input before the owning form can be submitted

props.name: id
props.description: The unique identifier for this control. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text

props.name: layout
props.description:
The direction the content flows.
Vertical layout is used by default, and horizontal layout is used for checkbox and radio inputs.

props.name: visuallyHidden
props.description: Whether the label should be visually hidden

props.name: as
props.description: The label element can be changed to a 'legend' when it's being used to label a fieldset, or a 'span' when it's being used to label an element that is not a form input. For example: when using a FormControl to render a labeled SegementedControl, the label should be a 'span'

props.name: requiredText
props.description: The text to display when the field is required

props.name: requiredIndicator
props.description: Whether to show or hide the required text in the accessibility tree, the required text is still shown visually.

props.name: htmlFor
props.description:
This prop may be used to override the `htmlFor` set from FormControl's React Context.
The unique identifier for the associated input

props.name: id
props.description:
When `as` prop is 'label', it may be used to override the `htmlFor` given to the `<label>` element by FormControl's React Context.
When 'as' prop is 'legend' or 'span', it is used as the `id` for the element.

props.name: id
props.description: Custom ID to override the ID set by FormControl's React Context

props.name: children
props.description: The content (usually just text) that is rendered to give contextual info about the field

props.name: children
props.description: The content (usually just text) that is rendered to give contextual info about the validation result for the field

props.name: variant
props.description: Changes the visual style to match the validation status

props.name: id
props.description: May be used to override the ID assigned by FormControl's React Context
